title: Phenotypic screening identified polydatin alleviating cartilage degeneration by modulating SIRT3-dependent mitochondrial dysfunction.
abstract: Osteoarthritis (OA) is a prevalent degenerative disease, characterized by articular cartilage lesions, synovial inflammation, and osteophyte formation, which ultimately results in joint deformity and limited mobility. Polyphenols, a class of bioactive phytochemicals widely distributed in traditional Chinese medicine, have been extensively utilized for centuries in the management of OA.
journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology
